3760.verse: إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|87|58$أَصْحَـٰبَ|(the) companions|136|169|4057$ٱلْجَنَّةِ|(of) Paradise|105|138|778$ٱلْيَوْمَ|this Day|74|107|2217$فِى|[in]|48|81|89$شُغُلٍ|will be occupied|125|142|14513$فَـٰكِهُونَ|(in) amusement,|128|128|14514$

3762.verse: لَهُمْ|For them|79|90|98$فِيهَا|therein|66|89|253$فَـٰكِهَةٌ|(are) fruits,|97|120|14518$وَلَهُم|and for them|105|128|71$مَّا|(is) whatever|109|132|262$يَدَّعُونَ|they call for.|105|116|14519$

3764.verse: وَٱمْتَـٰزُواْ|`But stand apart|132|207|14522$ٱلْيَوْمَ|this Day,|79|228|2217$أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ|O criminals!|165|240|14523$

3767.verse: وَلَقَدْ|And indeed,|98|105|640$أَضَلَّ|he led astray|107|122|14527$مِنكُمْ|from you|78|93|643$جِبِلاًّ|a multitude|94|109|14528$كَثِيرًا‌ۖ|great.|72|87|275$أَفَلَمْ|Then did not|104|119|9302$تَكُونُواْ|you|84|91|427$تَعْقِلُونَ|use reason?|99|99|453$

3770.verse: ٱلْيَوْمَ|This Day|77|90|2217$نَخْتِمُ|We will seal|97|123|14530$عَلَىٰٓ|[on]|63|89|52$أَفْوَٲهِهِمْ|their mouths,|108|134|3203$وَتُكَلِّمُنَآ|and will speak to Us|152|178|14531$أَيْدِيهِمْ|their hands,|99|112|757$وَتَشْهَدُ|and will bear witness|158|172|14532$أَرْجُلُهُم|their feet|91|120|14533$بِمَا|about what|96|125|43$كَانُواْ|they used (to)|117|146|94$يَكْسِبُونَ|earn.|97|112|759$

3771.verse: وَلَوْ|And if|58|80|179$نَشَآءُ|We willed,|87|130|5786$لَطَمَسْنَا|We (would have) surely obliterated|253|296|14534$عَلَىٰٓ|[over]|63|106|52$أَعْيُنِهِمْ|their eyes,|91|113|7292$فَٱسْتَبَقُواْ|then they (would) race|174|197|14535$ٱلصِّرَٲطَ|(to find) the path,|142|189|17$فَأَنَّىٰ|then how|82|129|5860$يُبْصِرُونَ|(could) they see?|137|160|7019$

3772.verse: وَلَوْ|And if|58|73|179$نَشَآءُ|We willed|82|112|5786$لَمَسَخْنَـٰهُمْ|surely, We (would have) transformed them|304|334|14536$عَلَىٰ|in|63|93|52$مَكَانَتِهِمْ|their places|97|112|14537$فَمَا|then not|77|93|132$ٱسْتَطَـٰعُواْ|they would have been able|199|232|1902$مُضِيًّا|to proceed|92|125|14538$وَلَا|and not|71|104|25$يَرْجِعُونَ|return.|105|121|3002$

3773.verse: وَمَن|And (he) whom|121|141|1012$نُّعَمِّرْهُ|We grant him long life,|169|209|14539$نُنَكِّسْهُ|We reverse him|122|162|14540$فِى|in|48|88|89$ٱلْخَلْقِ‌ۖ|the creation.|106|126|6513$أَفَلَا|Then will not|105|318|452$يَعْقِلُونَ|they use intellect?|143|356|1435$

3775.verse: لِّيُنذِرَ|To warn|74|85|10605$مَن|(him) who|86|107|76$كَانَ|is|57|78|913$حَيًّا|alive|52|73|11116$وَيَحِقَّ|and may be proved true|179|200|14543$ٱلْقَوْلُ|the Word|81|102|8490$عَلَى|against|68|79|52$ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ|the disbelievers.|128|128|364$

3760.verse: Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -

3761.verse: They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.

3762.verse: For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]

3763.verse: [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.

3764.verse: [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.

3765.verse: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -

3766.verse: And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.

3767.verse: And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?

3768.verse: This is the Hellfire which you were promised.

3769.verse: [Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."

3770.verse: That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.

3771.verse: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?

3772.verse: And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.

3773.verse: And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation; so will they not understand?

3774.verse: And We did not give Prophet Muhammad, knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an

3775.verse: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.
